Articles.Content:
Sigma: PluronKhato

 
This mod will add a Kerbal analogue to the Pluto-Charon system.

If used in combination with Sigma Binary it will be a binary system.
 




 
Dependencies

Requires Kopernicus and ModuleManager



Supported Mods

Sigma Binary: turns Pluron-Khato into a binary system.

Distant Object Enhancement bis: a visual enhancement mod that makes objects realistically visible over large distances.

PlanetShine: Illuminated planets and moons reflects (colored) light to your vessel.

KSP-AVC: Warns you when a new patch is released.

Outer Planets Mod: Pluron-Khato is moved to orbit the Sun slightly farther than Plock.

New Horizons: Pluron-Khato is moved to orbit the Sun between Titanus and Vanor.

Rescale Mods: KScale2, Kerbin 365, 64K, 10x Kerbol system




Images






How to install this mod
 
1 - Download the mod
2 - If you have an old version installed, delete the folder GameData/Sigma/PluronKhato
3 - Install the mod by merging the GameData folder from the archive with the one in your KSP install
4 - Make sure you have Kopernicus installed. If not, you can find it here.
5 - Make sure you have ModuleManager installed. If not, you can find it here.

or

Install it using CKAN


 

Downloads
 
Latest Release

@GitHub

If you want to contribute to my caffeine addiction:
 
Don't expect anything in return other than my sincere gratitude. 

 


ChangeLog

Code: 
v1.2.0

- Updated to KSP 1.0.5
- Updated to Kopernicus 0.5.2
- Updated to SigmaBinary v1.3.1
- Changed folder structure for On-Demand compatibility


v1.1.0

- Updated to SigmaBinary v1.2.1
- Using rescale mods will generate new cache files


v1.0.0

- First Release (non beta)

- KillAshley for his help with planet editing suggestions
- Thomas P. (again) for KittopiaTech
- Thomas P. (again 2.0) for taking the time of replying to my questions regarding Kopernicus
- pkmniako for designing the new download button
- CaptRobau & Eudae55 for Outer Planets Mod
- KillAshley (again) for New Horizons
- Paul Kingtiger for KScale2 and 64K
- Nolnoc for Kerbin 365
- jsimmons for 10x Kerbol system
- Many Others who I may have missed, they'll be added as soon as I remember 



License

Modification and/or redistribution of this mod or parts of it is allowed only with my permission.
If permission is granted, "Sigma88" must be credited as the original author of "Sigma: PluronKhato", a link to this thread must be included in the download of any edited/redistributed versions, the material cannot be used for commercial purposes.
I reserve the right to revoke said permission at any time.

I will list here any permission requests I decide to accept.
Edited May 24, 2016 by Sigma88
Update to 1.3.0
Now to make it look like (at least a bit) the real Pluto and Charon

Now to make it look like (at least a bit) the real Pluto and Charon

I think RSS and OPM will take care of making Pluto and Charon that look like the real planets.

This is why I decided to keep the original models I had for Pluron-Khato
Awesome, I will have to add these to my list of potential new finds in the stock system

Awesome, I will have to add these to my list of potential new finds in the stock system

I hope you like it

So far away, I can see only Jool or infinite fuel to get there lol.

So far away, I can see only Jool or infinite fuel to get there lol.

don't forget to bring a lot of snacks for the travel

don't forget to bring a lot of snacks for the travel
I won't, I also enjoy my share of snacks. Let's just hope Bob enjoys the journey.
Do you have any plans to add in analogues to Pluto's other 4 moons?

Do you have any plans to add in analogues to Pluto's other 4 moons?

I don't at the moment, but you never know

I originally made these planets because I wanted to see if it was possible to make a binary system in KSP (everybody was saying no)

when I ultimately got it working I received a lot of positive feedback that ultimately lead to the release of SigmaBinary

Now the original purpose of the pack is completely fulfilled, but if one day I'll want to experiment with other aspects of planet creation I may end up coming back to this
